result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant John C Newsom in court.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for John C Newsom.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant John C Newsom in court.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for John C Newsom.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status following case #18CF3667.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant John C Newsom in court.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for John C Newsom.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status following the jury trial in case #18CF3667.  Case adjourned for status in Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9.2.22

Defendant John C Newsom in court.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for John C Newsom.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8.22.22

Defendant John C Newsom in court in person with Attorney Jade K Hall who appears by video.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer N. Romeo. Court took judicial notice of 18CF3667. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6.29.2022
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant John C Newsom in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant John C Newsom in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  John C Newsom appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s) 1. 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
